titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ulysses S. Grant Foundation Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 10:59

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of annual reports, proposals, correspondence, and meeting minutes maintained by James R. Vivian, chairman of the Ulysses S. Grant Foundation board of directors.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ulysses S. Grant Foundation Records (RU 895). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by record type.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ulysses S. Grant Foundation is an educational enrichment program for academically talented and motivated middle school students from New Haven, Connecticut. The program is designed to prepare students with limited opportunities and resources for entry and success in college.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of annual reports, proposals, correspondence, and meeting minutes maintained by James R. Vivian, chairman of the Ulysses S. Grant Foundation board of directors.

did.unittitle: Records of James Vivian as chairman of the board of directors
